header_summary:
The recent discussions across various Bitcoin development forums highlight significant advancements and challenges in the realm of cryptocurrency technology and consensus mechanisms. /dev /fd0 introduces an experimental library, joinstr, aimed at bolstering application development for coinjoin, inviting developers to contribute to its evolution and enhance privacy in digital currency transactions ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALiT-Zp2mb9yGrup=MGUP6xiOvV-uxoWT23fkwMi2yw2F3=EBg@mail.gmail.com/T/#u#m4d4e06bb5baa4b70a396253d13265106ced292d5)). Jose Storopoli and his team at Alpen Labs propose the Bitcoin Output Script Descriptor (BOSD), a novel specification to streamline on-chain withdrawals for Bitcoin Layer 2 solutions, emphasizing standard transaction compliance and minimizing ecosystem fragmentation, with the project details and open-source Rust implementation available for community input ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/94ac8f66-1627-4526-bb34-095361a30fb4n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#mfe81791c5159867a73965164ac552f23d76dbd5c)).

Ariard addresses the ongoing dialogue around the development of covenants and contracting primitives for cryptocurrencies, highlighting the struggle to achieve social consensus due to a diversity of ideas and the need for a comprehensive technical archive to facilitate a unified approach to consensus change ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bitcoin-forking-guide/1451/2)). Meanwhile, ajtowns announces the release of Bitcoin Inquisition 28.1, integrating features from Bitcoin Core 28.1 and supporting several proposed consensus changes to enhance the flexibility and capabilities of Bitcoin transactions, detailed further for developers and users interested in exploring these new features ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/bitcoin-inquisition-28-1/1445)).

Lastly, MattCorallo discusses the nuances of pathfinding within the network, acknowledging its current challenges and the varied impact on privacy and network efficiency. Despite concerns, there is a general consensus toward managing these issues pragmatically, with an openness to future adjustments as the technological landscape evolves ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/highly-available-lightning-channels-revisited-route-or-out/1438/6)). Together, these discussions underscore the ongoing efforts within the Bitcoin development community to address technical challenges, enhance transaction privacy and efficiency, and foster a collaborative environment for innovation and improvement.

recent_posts.title: Rust library for joinstr (coinjoin implementation)
recent_posts.summary:
- Pythcoiner shared insights on Twitter about the rust implementation of joinstr.
- Developers are encouraged to review the experimental library for coinjoin applications.
- Pythcoiner welcomes further communication via email or simplex chat for collaboration.

recent_posts.title: Announcing Bitcoin BOSD: Standardized Withdrawal Output Specification for L2s
recent_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin Output Script Descriptor enhances on-chain withdrawals for Bitcoin L2 solutions.
- BOSD provides a standardized, compact representation of withdrawal outputs, improving validation logic.
- The initiative, developed by Alpen Labs and available on crates.io, encourages open access and collaboration.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Forking Guide
recent_posts.summary:
- The programming community faces challenges in developing cryptocurrencies, particularly in consensus building.
- A high-quality technical archive is needed to unify approaches and facilitate progress.
- Efforts like the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives Working Group seek to improve documentation and discussion.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Inquisition 28.1
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Inquisition 28.1 integrates features from Bitcoin Core 28.1, now available for download.
- It introduces backported support for ephemeral dust and several proposed consensus changes.
- These upgrades aim to enhance Bitcoin's operational framework and consensus mechanisms.

recent_posts.title: Highly Available Lightning Channels Revisited – ROUTE OR OUT
recent_posts.summary:
- Pathfinding in networks is currently manageable, despite challenges for some groups.
- Privacy concerns exist for individuals running full lightning nodes, impacting a declining number.
- A pragmatic approach is advocated, focusing on future adjustments for network efficiency and robustness.

active_posts.title: Reiterating centralized coinjoin (Wasabi & Samourai) deanonymization attacks
active_posts.summary:
- Vulnerabilities in Wasabi & GingerWallet reveal significant deanonymization risks.
- Whirlpool and WabiSabi protocols' design flaws allow malicious coordinators to deanonymize transactions.
- Economic incentives and security mechanisms fail to prevent user fund thefts, underlining privacy concerns.

active_posts.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin community is addressing vulnerabilities highlighted in the 2019 Great Consensus Cleanup.
- Critical updates include measures against the timewarp and Murch-Zawy attacks, and enhanced merkle tree security.
- A draft Bitcoin Improvement Proposal is in progress, aiming to strengthen Bitcoin's network security.

active_posts.title: Proposal for Quantum-Resistant Address Migration Protocol (QRAMP) BIP
active_posts.summary:
- The new BIP, QRAMP, aims to protect Bitcoin from quantum threats by updating addresses.
- It sets a strict timeline for moving funds to quantum-resistant addresses to counter risks.
- The proposal, open for feedback on GitHub, seeks to bolster Bitcoin against quantum attacks.

active_posts.title: How to linearize your cluster
active_posts.summary:
- Efficient linearization algorithms improve cryptocurrency transaction processing by sorting based on fee rates.
- Advanced strategies like bottleneck splitting and iterative search enhance the selection of high-feerate transactions.
- The current implementation employs caching and LIFO stacks to optimize transaction selection and minimize computation.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposed BIP aims to make Bitcoin quantum resistant by updating its signature algorithm.
- It marks the beginning of efforts to create a "QuBit" soft fork for future security.
- The proposal is open for public review to refine and validate quantum-resistant measures.

active_posts.title: Hybrid Jamming Mitigation: Results and Updates
active_posts.summary:
- The blog details a study on improving lightning channel resilience against jamming via a hybrid approach.
- It reveals additional protections are needed against certain attackers, based on "attackathon" findings.
- Advancements include a bidirectional reputation system to better safeguard against malicious activities.

today_in_history_posts.title: Simple lock/unlock mechanism
authors: アルム　カールヨハン
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A new Bitcoin standard aims to prevent theft by locking UTXOs via a P2SH address and OP_CSV.
- Bitcoin Core may add "freeze" and "unfreeze" commands to enable/disable access to locked Bitcoins for specified days.
- While effective against robberies, the system risks high transaction fees and stuck transactions.

today_in_history_posts.title: Pizza for (lightning) bitcoins?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- A man used the lightning network for a pizza trade through a friend in London.
- They used a bolt11 invoice and a payment hash preimage to confirm the transaction.
- The transaction showcased, despite its complexity, why lightning nodes are uncommon for such trades.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies are classified as passive or active, with different engagement levels.
- Passive investment issues include the principal/agent problem and potential for underutilized assets.
- The article explores stabilizing economies with a currency system combining inflationary and deflationary aspects.
